intro: Lygistum reclinatum, commonly known as the reclining lygistum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lygistum reclinatum is noted for its ability to thrive in temperate climates and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
